title: ISic001835. Inscribed theatre seat
body:
1Φιλιστοῦς Δ .

1ΦΙΛΙΣΤΟΥΣΔ·

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from autopsy;
  • 1: Dimartino: ΔΒ; Kaibel ΔΙ// (intended to illustrate damage to the right of the vertical); lapis: the surface is lost to the right of a vertical stroke, compatible with e.g. Β also

translation

of Philisto D[-]

commentary

It is not possible to say whether the final letter is an Iota or another letter beginning with a vertical, given the damage to the stone. It is possible that this bore same ΔΒ as on ISic001834; but Β, Γ, Ε, Η, Ι, Κ, Μ, Ν, Π, Ρ are all theoretically possible.

bibliography

  • 14.0437.4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 59.1132 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • 5233 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000817
  • Dimartino 2017 testo e https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002579
  • Dimartino 2009 722 no. e https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001364
  • De Spuches 1864 13 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002042
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
